page.title: 09PARISH CHURCH OF ST.PETER.
page.content:
Maudlin Farm is just off the main road, and the fields are used for wheat and barley.(by Paul Egerton).
{The Parish Church of St.Peter.} The first Church dates back to 700 to 725. It was built on the edge of Stane Street, the old Roman Road. The present nave was built at the end of the twelfth century but the north pillars and aisle were constructed in 1867. In the middle ages the Church was used by pligrims journeying along Stane Street to the Shrine of St. Richard of Chichester in the Cathedral There is a tomb of Richard Sackville and his wife from about 1540 and the tower has three bells dated 1581 and 1632. In the graveyard lies James Lilleywhite a famous cricketer, who died in 1929 and Three Bishops{GILBERT {1842/70; DUNFORD 1870/95 WILBERFORCE
